skill.name: task-runner
skill.description: Run project commands with just. Check for justfile in project root, list available tasks, execute common operations like test, build, lint. Triggers on: run tests, build project, list tasks, check available commands, run script, project commands.
skill.summary: Run project commands with just. Check for justfile in project root, list available tasks, execute co...
skill.author: 0xDarkMatter

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only documentation for using the just CLI tool. No file access, network calls, environment variable access, or command execution capabilities within the skill itself.

content.value_statement: Developers waste time searching for build instructions and memorizing project-specific commands. This skill provides a standardized way to discover and run any task defined in a project justfile, from testing to deployment.
actual_capabilities: List all available recipes in a justfile
Run specific recipes like test, build, and lint
Check for justfile existence in project root
limitations: Requires just CLI tool to be installed separately
Cannot run commands outside of defined justfile recipes
Limited to recipes defined in project justfile

use_cases.title: Streamline Development Workflow
use_cases.description: Quickly discover and run project commands without reading documentation or searching for scripts.

use_cases.title: Standardize Build Processes
use_cases.description: Execute consistent build, test, and deployment commands across different projects using justfiles.

use_cases.title: Onboard to Unknown Projects
use_cases.description: Explore unfamiliar codebases by listing available commands and understanding project structure.

prompt_templates.title: List Available Tasks
prompt_templates.prompt: What commands are available in this project? Show me all the just recipes.

prompt_templates.title: Run Tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the tests for this project using just.

prompt_templates.title: Build Project
prompt_templates.prompt: Build this project. What build commands are available?

prompt_templates.title: Deploy with Args
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy to production using just. The deploy command takes an environment argument.

output_examples.input: What commands are available in this project?
output: build       Build with npm run build
lint        Lint code with ruff and eslint
deploy      Deploy to environment (takes env arg)

best_practices: Check for a justfile immediately when entering a new project using 'just --list'
Use 'just --show <recipe>' to understand what a command does before running it
Run recipes with arguments by providing them after the recipe name
anti_patterns: Running unknown just recipes without checking what they do first
Assuming just is installed without verifying
Hardcoding commands that should be defined in the justfile

faq.question: How do I install just?
faq.answer: Install with brew install just on macOS or cargo install just on Linux, Windows, and macOS.

faq.question: What if no justfile exists?
faq.answer: The skill will report that no justfile was found. Ask the project maintainers to add one.

faq.question: Can I run commands from subdirectories?
faq.answer: Yes, use just --justfile path/to/justfile <recipe> to run recipes from subdirectory justfiles.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads justfile configurations and runs predefined recipes. It does not access or modify other files.

faq.question: Why is my command not working?
faq.answer: Ensure just is installed. Verify the recipe name matches exactly. Check that a justfile exists in the project.

faq.question: How is this different from make?
faq.answer: Just is simpler, cross-platform, and uses shell syntax. It does not require tabs and has more intuitive recipe definitions.
